org.mu.util

Interface Retryer.Delay

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<Retryer.Delay>
    Enclosing class:
    Retryer

    public static interface Retryer.Delay
extends Comparable<Retryer.Delay>
    Represents a single delay interval between attempts.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void afterDelay(Throwable exception)
      Called after the delay, immediately before the retry.
      default void beforeDelay(Throwable exception)
      Called if exception will be retried after the delay.
      default int compareTo(Retryer.Delay that) 
      java.time.Duration duration()
      Returns the delay interval.
      default List<Retryer.Delay> exponentialBackoff(double multiplier, int size)
      Returns an immutable List of delays with size.
      static <T> List<T> guarded(List<T> list, java.util.function.BooleanSupplier condition)
      Similar to timed(), this method wraps list to make it empty when condition becomes false.
      default Retryer.Delay multipliedBy(double multiplier)
      Returns a new Delay with duration multiplied by multiplier.
      static Retryer.Delay of(java.time.Duration duration)
      Returns a Delay of duration.
      static Retryer.Delay ofMillis(long millis)
      Shorthand for new Delay(Duration.ofMillis(millis)).
      static <T> List<T> timed(List<T> delays, java.time.Duration totalDuration)
      Returns a wrapper of list that while not modifiable, can suddenly become empty when totalDuration has elapsed since the time the wrapper was created.
      static <T> List<T> timed(List<T> list, java.time.Duration totalDuration, java.time.Clock clock)
      Returns a wrapper of list that while not modifiable, can suddenly become empty when totalDuration has elapsed since the time the wrapper was created.

    • Method Detail

      • duration

        java.time.Duration duration()
        Returns the delay interval.

      • ofMillis

        static Retryer.Delay ofMillis(long millis)
        Shorthand for new Delay(Duration.ofMillis(millis)).

      • of

        static Retryer.Delay of(java.time.Duration duration)
        Returns a Delay of duration.

      • timed

        static <T> List<T> timed(List<T> list,
                         java.time.Duration totalDuration,
                         java.time.Clock clock)
        Returns a wrapper of list that while not modifiable, can suddenly become empty when totalDuration has elapsed since the time the wrapper was created. clock is used to measure time.

      • timed

        static <T> List<T> timed(List<T> delays,
                         java.time.Duration totalDuration)
        Returns a wrapper of list that while not modifiable, can suddenly become empty when totalDuration has elapsed since the time the wrapper was created.

      • guarded

        static <T> List<T> guarded(List<T> list,
                           java.util.function.BooleanSupplier condition)
        Similar to timed(), this method wraps list to make it empty when condition becomes false.

      • exponentialBackoff

        default List<Retryer.Delay> exponentialBackoff(double multiplier,
                                               int size)
        Returns an immutable List of delays with size. The first delay (if size > 0) is this and the following delays are exponentially multiplied using multiplier.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - must be positive.
        size - must not be negative.

      • multipliedBy

        default Retryer.Delay multipliedBy(double multiplier)
        Returns a new Delay with duration multiplied by multiplier.

      • compareTo

        default int compareTo(Retryer.Delay that)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Retryer.Delay>

      • beforeDelay

        default void beforeDelay(Throwable exception)
        Called if exception will be retried after the delay.

      • afterDelay

        default void afterDelay(Throwable exception)
        Called after the delay, immediately before the retry.
